climbs.name: Table for 300
climbs.fa: David Speyrer, Vance Atkins, & Haychoi Tiang

content.description:
The butt-dragging extension start to Dining in Hell on the Thermopylae Wall. Sit start low and right matched on a blocky jug (see photo) and traverse up and left, finishing on Dining in Hell. Fun moves.

The Thermopylae Wall is about 150 feet uphill and slightly west of Stinkin' Slopers, and immediately downhill of Balance of Power. This would be a fine place to hold off a vast Persian army with a small band of Spartans. On the right side of this wall is the classic Gates of Fire.

Mega classic line up the right side of the Thermopylae Wall! Stretch or jump up to the first good hold and climb the right-leaning flake system up the overhanging wall, topping out on jugs after a high crux. The further right you top out, the more you'll be over nasty boulders below.

A sit start will add considerable difficulty but not necessarily considerable fun. You decide.
content.protection: 3 or more pads. The landing is uneven but can be made safe with pads and diligent spotting.
content.location: The Thermopylae Wall is about 150 feet uphill and slightly west of Stinkin' Slopers, and immediately downhill of Balance of Power. This would be a fine place to hold off a vast Persian army with a small band of Spartans. On the left side of this wall check out Dine in Hell and Table for 300.

content.description: Sit start on the horn of the lowest rail and head straight up good rails to the top.
content.location: This problem is on the smaller boulder right below the Thermopylae Wall, but above Brick Layer.

content.description: Located about 30 feet left of 'Gates of Fire' in the dihedral on Thermopylae Wall.  Sitdown start on a sloping ledge on the right side of the dihedral, layback up the flare and top out left.  'Table for 300' is an extension of this problem, sitdown start from good holds about 8 feet right of the dihedral (V3/4).
content.protection: 1-2 pads - landing is flat, although a spotter is good to keep you off blocks adjacent to the problem.
content.location: The Thermopylae Wall is about 150 feet uphill and slightly west of Stinkin' Slopers, and immediately downhill of Balance of Power.

content.description: This is a relatively easy climb with big moves between huge brick shaped holds up a striking overhanging boulder. It is high enough and has a bad enough landing to feel spicy if you aren't used to airing it out, but the excellent holds and interesting moves make this a climb not to be missed.
content.protection: 3 to 5 pads and spotters, if you think you might fall
content.location: About 50 meters up and left of the Tetris boulder, along the trail that takes you to Gates of Fire

content.description: In the center of the boulder a long crimper rail leads up and right. Start matched on the rail and climb up, trying your best not to break the wafer (you'll know it when you grab it). Technical and strenuous.
content.protection: The landing seems nasty at first but cleans up nicely with two or more pads.
content.location: Head about 200 feet uphill from Stinkin' Slopers, trending slightly west. Balance of Power sits in a sunny talus field just uphill from a large overhanging wall.
